lead_paragraph: A possible unification of America’s two open-wheel series was still on track, with both sides saying Tuesday progress was being made. David Higdon, a spokesman for the Champ Car World Series, said discussions were “heating up.” Fred Nation, a spokesman for the Indy Racing League, said I.R.L. officials remained optimistic an agreement could be reached. Each series has struggled for fans, sponsors and TV ratings since the I.R.L., founded by Tony George, the Indianapolis Motor Speedway president, began competition in 1995.
